div.p: Second Book of Architecture by Jacques Androuet du Cerceau. Containing several and various ordonnances of chimneys, lucarnes, doors, fountains, wells, and pavillions, to enrich the interiors as much as the exteriors of all buildings. Including designs for ten tombs, all different. In Paris, Printed for Jacuqes Androuet du Cerceau. 1561.
